greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(6*n).
comment: Conjectures: sigma(6n) > sigma(6n - 1) and sigma(6n) > sigma(6n + 1).

Conjectures are false. Try prime 73961483429 for n. One finds sigma(6*73961483429) < sigma(6*73961483429+1). The number n = 105851369791 provides a counterexample for the other case. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 22 2013
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Apr 22 2013
